title: Wires Down (Ice Storm)
medium: graphite, wash and gouache on paper mounted on cardboard
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Charles E. Burchfield [1893-1967], West Seneca, NY; Frank K. M. Rehn, Inc., New York, NY, until November 1945; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, November 20, 1945 until June 7, 1946 [1]; their gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, June 1946.

Notes:
[1]. Mrs. Beal purchased the watercolor for $900 from the Rehn Gallery in November 1945 (see curatorial file for original receipt of payment for the purchase, dated November 20, 1945 and copies of correspondence with the gallery from Archives of American Art.) See also "The Beal Collection of American Art," Carnegie Museum of Art, 1994, page 76.

creator.death_place: West Seneca (Erie county, New York state, United States)
